channel.title: Comments on: Deploying Database Changes with PowerShell
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQL Server Designers, Failed Saves, and Generated Scripts | XL-UAT
item.dc:creator: SQL Server Designers, Failed Saves, and Generated Scripts | XL-UAT
item.description: […] IMHO, rather than just relying on SSMS to generate change scripts for databases, you should look into some sort of deployment framework that can be tweaked as per your need and can be automated. Refer to : Deploying Database Changes with PowerShell […]
item.content:encoded: […] IMHO, rather than just relying on SSMS to generate change scripts for databases, you should look into some sort of deployment framework that can be tweaked as per your need and can be automated. Refer to : Deploying Database Changes with PowerShell […]

item.title: By: Wes Shaddix
item.dc:creator: Wes Shaddix
item.description: Nice. I had a similar experience as you and ended up creating SqlCi (https://github.com/wshaddix/sqlci) <br />
item.content:encoded: Nice. I had a similar experience as you and ended up creating SqlCi (https://github.com/wshaddix/sqlci)
